content:
Great to see my photos in print in #Faroese media!

N√≥lsoyar P√°ll Statue illustrates an article on smallpox in 2020 issue of #Dimmal√¶tting. @FaroeseStamps magazine, in its latest issue, published an article on @foroya_bjor where my picture of its logo is used.

The #Gj√≥gv incline railway is the only operating #Faroese #railway, transporting goods and small boats. The #narrow-gauge line follows a steep incline in the local #harbour.

#sporsmalur = spor - rail, #track + smalur - narrow, small

#f√∏royskt

Between #Ei√∞i and #Funningur lies the highest #Faroese mountain - #Sl√¶ttaratindur (#sl√¶ttur refers to the summit‚Äôs flat surface)

Since 2012 its elevation is no longer 882 meters, but "only" 880 m. But it's still one of ten mountains which rise to over 800 m ASL

#f√∏royskt

The #Faroese native #Angelica archangelica (#hvonn) was gathered in the wild and cultivated in gardens. It was served as a dessert, with cream or thick sour milk.

The village of #Hvannasund took its name from the plant - it's "the sound of angelicas".

#FaroeIslands #f√∏royskt

Good news, everyone! Google #Translate now "speaks" #Faroese!

setur.fo/fo/setrid/tidindi/n‚Ä¶

Clothes #pegs in #M√∫li, #Bor√∞oy. Anyone doing their #laundry there? üòÄ

#Faroese word #klemma is also a verb that means to squeeze, hug, cuddle; get jammed, get caught.

üá´üá¥ #FaroeIslands #f√∏royskt

The bus stop at Ger√∞isbreyt in #Velbasta√∞ur.

One can enjoy the view over #Koltur while waiting for a bus no 5 or Saturday-only route 7 (connecting #Kirkjub√∏ur with #Kollafj√∏r√∞ur). And they're free, thanks to @TKommuna!

#Busslei√∞in @VisitTorshavn #FaroeIslands #f√∏royskt

#Haraldssund (pop. 67) is located on the east coast of #Kunoy and was probably founded before 1200.

Surrounded by high mountains it's the least sunny of all #Faroese settlements. Its name refers to the sound separating #Kunoy and #Vi√∞oy that it lies by.

#FaroeseCities #f√∏royskt

#Porkeri (pop. 317) is a #Faroese village on #Su√∞uroy. 
According to legend, the local chieftain, #Hovgr√≠mur, had a #pig farm in this spot - he named it #Purkurger√∞i (field of sows), which later became Porkeri.

#FaroeIslands #FaroeseCities #f√∏royskt

#H√∫sar (pop. 35) is the most populated and the oldest village on #Kalsoy. Its name is a plural form of the #Faroese word ‚Äúh√∫si‚Äù - a house. The village stone church was built in 1920.

#FaroeIslands #FaroeseCities

#Oyrareingir (pop. 45) is situated at the very head of the Kollafj√∏r√∞ur-fjord on #Streymoy. Its name in #f√∏royskt comes from words #oyrar (from oyri) that means sandy spit and #eingir - a meadow.

#FaroeIslands #FaroeseCities

#Dandelion (#v√°rhagas√≥lja) is known for its yellow #flower heads that turn into silver balls. Common in the #FaroeIslands is #Taraxacum faeroense with bluish grey-green leaves

Its #Faroese name can be translated as spring (v√°r-) wild (haga) buttercup (s√≥lja)

#flora #f√∏royskt

#Kollafj√∏r√∞ur (pop. 828) is #FaroeIslands #longest settlement. It stretches on both sides of the fjord and lies at the foot of the #Dyllan mountain

The rounded shape of the mountain gave the town its name - #kollur is #Faroese for ‚Äúround top‚Äù

#f√∏royskt x.com/ForoysktDaily/status/1‚Ä¶

#Jar√∞arhumla / Buff-tailed #bumblebee / Bombus terrestris (seen on the photo above) has been first recorded on #FaroeIslands in #Tv√∏royri in May 2017.

-- jenskjeld.info/FO_side/humla‚Ä¶

They are built strong, they hum and they are hairy. #humla is #Faroese for #bumblebee

The first bumblebee was caught in the #FaroeIslands in 1887. Since then there have been some very few observations. They become more frequent recently

jenskjeld.info #f√∏royskt

They are built strong, they hum and they are hairy. #humla is #Faroese for #bumblebee

The first bumblebee was caught in the #FaroeIslands in 1887. Since then there have been some very few observations. They become more frequent recently

jenskjeld.info

#f√∏royskt #fauna

The #Faroese #WordOfTheYear 2023 is #vitl√≠ki - artificial intelligence. It comes from words #vit (intelligence, brains) and #l√≠ki (equal, like)

The #√°rsinsor√∞ has been chosen from the shortlist provided by the listeners of the "G√≥√∞an morgun F√∏royar" programme

#f√∏royskt  #AI

Against all odds

#FaroeIslands (population 55.000) has beaten many giants on the path to our first-ever European Handball Championships. The #EHFEURO2024 is in Berlin. Over 5K or 10% of our population has gone to #Berlin to support the team

üá´üá¥ üí™
WHAT A MOMENT! üá´üá¥

The M/F #Teistin #ferry used to operate the route between¬†#Skopun and ¬†#Gamlar√¶tt before the #Sandoyartunnilin tunnel opened in December 2023.

Built in 2001 on #FaroeIslands in #Sk√°la, its name translates to #guillemot (Cepphus grylle).

#f√∏royskt #StrandfaraskipLandsins

#Hvalv√≠k (pop. 262) lies by the #bay, where pilot #whales have long been driven ashore and beached - hence the name.

The #church in Hvalv√≠k is the oldest of the traditional #Faroese wooden black churches.
